intro: Psychotria gracilior, commonly known as the slender psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, lanceolate leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The plant is also known for its alkaloid content, which has been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
